Recap: Claiming to have lost his balance, Jack apologizes to Olivia, who decides to get out of his house immediately. Afraid of having blown his chance to get his hands on Caleb's ring again, he goes after her with the box of her things. Admitting that he didn't really lose his balance, Jack says that he almost kissed her--and she almost let him. Alison and Caleb talk about friendship, which is new territory for the vampire. When they step outside, a photographer snaps some photos, and Caleb destroys the film. Alison persuades him not to harm the man, saying that it's for Caleb's own good. Before leaving, she plants a charm from her bracelet at the loft. Feeling challenged, Jack kisses Olivia. Jamal attacks an intruder in Imani's room, who turns out to be Rafe. Jamal wants Rafe's help finding her, but the slayer insists that Jamal forget ever having met her. He alleges that every wish made on the ring is turning dangerous. Jack uses Olivia's jealousy of Alison to plant more seeds of doubt about her future with Caleb. Searching for Imani, Jamal finds a paw print and a scrap of cloth. The "photographer" quits his assignment, informing Rafe that he's not being paid enough for such a dangerous job. Jack tapes the box of Olivia's things closed. Caleb denies Olivia's request to touch the ring.
Transcript: Alison: Rafe -- stop. What have you done? Oh, my god, you have to come back to me. What have you done?
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Music plays]
Jamal: Mmm. I am the man.
Imani: Wow! Am I in the right house?
Jamal: Oh, you're in the right house.
Imani: What smells so good?

Jamal: Oh, just a little something that I whipped up. I mean, I figured that since you'd been living in a motel and everything that you probably wanted a meal that didn't come out of a vending machine. Was I right? Have a seat.
Imani: Yes.
Jamal: Yeah?
Imani: Very thoughtful.
Jamal: Well, then, let's get this party started. Let's do it right. A little bit of wine.
Imani: Mmm.
Jamal: One for you --
Imani: Mmm.
Jamal: One for me. A little more for me
Imani: Mmm. All right. Landlord --
Jamal: Mm-hmm.
Imani: Bodyguard, chef? Either you're too good to be true or there's a catch.
Jamal: Oh, I'm true. But there is a catch. You see, now that we're roommates and everything --
Imani: Mm-hmm?
Jamal: It's time that we lay down a couple of the ground rules. Rule number one -- and this one's a deal breaker, so --
Imani: Ok.
Jamal: I cooked, so you got to clean. And it looks like I dirtied every single pot in the house, so you've got some cleaning to do.
Imani: No!
Jamal: Yeah.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kevin: If you want to get your life back together, you have to move. So move.
[Kevin groans]
Kevin: Now, that's more like it. Today the finger, tomorrow the world.
Ian: Hey.
Lucy: Hi.
Kevin: Hello.
Lucy: Everything's great at the lighthouse. I think we've gotten everything set up for you.
Ian: Ramp's installed, nurses, meds -- all there.
Kevin: Great. Sounds like you thought of everything.
Lucy: I hope so. We just really want you to be comfortable. So, anything -- any change at all?
Kevin: No, no. Nothing at all. I'm ready to go home.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Caleb: Why are you stopping?
Livvie: Just keep your eyes closed, my love. Just put yourself in my hands. Relax and just --
Caleb: Just what? What else could you possibly do?
Livvie: Well, I could take my robe off slow. Is that better?
Caleb: You always know just how to get to me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Livvie: I feel like we're in synch.
Caleb: There is something different about you. I can see it in your eyes.
Livvie: It's because I finally feel I can be all you want me to be and more, so much more.
Caleb: More is good.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lucy: If you need anything at all, I hope you will call us any time, night or day.
Kevin: Thanks, but I won't be. I mean, it's not that I don't appreciate everything you've done. It's just that I need to start doing things on my own.
Lucy: Right. So, I guess this is goodbye, then.
Kevin: Yeah.
Ian: This is never going to stop being awkward, is it?
Kevin: No, but thanks for everything you've done.
Lucy: Hey!
Christina: Daddy, daddy!
Kevin: Well, there's my little girl. What you got there?
Christina: For you.
Lucy: Oh. That's Gemma.
Kevin: Oh, now, that's your favorite doll. Oh.
Christina: So you won't be lonely.
Lucy: He won't be lonely. You're going to be able to call him and visit him anytime you want, sweet pea.
Ian: I'll drive you to the lighthouse whenever you want.
Christina: Ok. For you.
Kevin: Oh, honey. Well -- oh, honey, I'm sorry.
Christina: I'll get it.
Lucy: Ok, be real careful, pumpkin head. Be careful.
Kevin: Careful, honey. You don't want to hit your --
Lucy: The table has a sharp edge.
Kevin: Yeah, listen to mommy. You don't -- ah!
Christina: Daddy!
Lucy: Come here, come here. Come here. Your arm. You moved your arm.
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Music plays]
Imani: So you are really not going to tell me what you're making?
Jamal: No, I'm not going to tell you.
Imani: Come on!
Jamal: It's a secret family recipe. Ok, look, if I tell you, I got to kill you. You know the deal with that.
Imani: Come on, man, just give me a hint.
Jamal: I am so dead serious, you don't even know.
Imani: Give me a hint.
Jamal: Nope. Now, don't you have some patience --
Imani: Oh, you're not right!
Jamal: Stop, stop. Have some patience woman, ok? And you better like what I'm making, too, because if you don't, let's just say it's a good thing that we live behind the restaurant.
Imani: Good plan.
Jamal: Mm-hmm.
Imani: Come on! So let me slice, dice, make you something.
Jamal: Woman, would you just --
Imani: Let me help you.
Jamal: Chill out! Ok? Just sit down, stay there, ok? You've been waiting on people hand and foot all day, and all night, and tonight you're not going to lift a finger.
Imani: I thought all the good ones were taken.
Jamal: We're just stuck in the kitchen. It's good to see you smile.
Imani: The stove -- your little pot thingie is boiling over.
Jamal: Oh, yeah, yeah. You have a way of -- ahem -- distracting me.
Imani: Well, I better let the cook concentrate.
Jamal: Right, right, right. Let me concentrate because if you don't, then, you know, this whole dinner thing -- if I do a wrong move, it's going to turn into a bad science project.
Imani: This reminds me of hanging out in my grandmother's kitchen.
Jamal: Yeah?

Imani: Yeah. All the smells and laughter, and pies cooling on the windowsill. Sunday dinner at Madea's was like a little slice of heaven. She'd start cooking after church, then finish really late. God, we would get so stuffed, we'd have to just roll ourselves home.
[Jamal laughs]
Imani: If you don't go back for seconds, she gets her feelings hurt. And if you don't go back for thirds, she really gets her pride hurt.
Jamal: She seems like a real cool lady. You talk about her like she's still here.
Imani: I guess she's still alive in my heart.
Jamal: Well, you know, I'm sorry. I know you don't like to talk about the past too much.
Imani: What's the point? What matters is now. And I'm going to go take a hot shower right now because I have to go back to work later -- if there's enough time before dinner.
Jamal: Oh, yeah, yeah, you've got time.
Imani: Ok.
Jamal: You know you can't rush a genius or anything like that, so --
Imani: Of course. Right, of course.
Jamal: Shower away.
Imani: Of course, all right.
[Door closes]
Jamal: I want to know everything about you, Ms. Imani, even if you don't want to tell me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jack: Ok, ok, I got here as soon as I could. I couldn't understand you on the phone, though. What --
Alison: It's Rafe.
Jack: Ok, ok, sit down, sit down and tell me the whole story.
Alison: Rafe found a direct line to Caleb's ring and where it came from.
Jack: Well, I thought the ring came from -- oh, no. No, tell me he didn't.
Alison: I don't know. I don't know if he did or not, but he started singing all these words, and then there was this big flash of light and then he was gone.
Jack: Fool!
Alison: He just vanished.
Jack: He tells us to be safe, and here he is taking a road trip to hell?
Alison: Well, I think he was trying to protect us from that ring because it can do some really dangerous stuff, but I don't -- I don't know what to do now.
Jack: I mean, Rafe's gone to the dark side before and he's made it back ok.
Alison: No, but this feels different. This is, like, evil.
Jack: We just have to give him some time.
Alison: Jack, what if there isn't any time? What if he doesn't have any more time?
Jack: Ok. Calm down, calm down. You can not whip yourself into a panic over this.
Alison: Well, you're not helping me right now!
Jack: Well, if I had a magic word to bring him back, don't you think I would?
Alison: Oh, yeah.
Jack: Whoa, what -- whoa, where are you going?
Alison: I'm sorry, but I have to go see someone.
Jack: Oh, I don't like the sound of this.
Alison: Look, there's only one person that can help me right now bring back Rafe, and that is Caleb.
Jack: No, no. I'm not letting you throw yourself in front of him.
Alison: Rafe is lost right now, and I don't know if I'm going to get him back. Now, come on. I need your help.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Caleb: You make it so hard to keep my hands off you.
Livvie: I was right there with you. And we were so connected. These are the moments I live for, when we make sense together, when you make me feel like the whole world is mine for the taking.
Caleb: Ours for the taking. Isn't that the way it's supposed to be?
Livvie: I just -- sometimes I get so jealous and insecure. I feel like there's something inside of me that feels a little bit lost.
Caleb: In these moments, you feel my love, don't you? You feel my devotion?
Livvie: I do.
Caleb: As you are devoted to me, right?
Livvie: I want to hold on to this moment forever.
Caleb: This is the way it always should be. No lies. No deception. This is the way it should be, right, Olivia?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ian: Feel that?
Kevin: No.
Ian: How about in here?
Kevin: Ah! Right there, right there. Yeah.
Ian: You're making progress.
Lucy: I got Christina all settled in.
Kevin: Is she all right? I didn't mean to frighten her.

Lucy: She's fine. She was just a little scared. I don't think she understood what happened to her daddy. I tried to say maybe it was like pins and needles in your arm, kind of like when her foot falls asleep in bed.
Ian: Well, the pain you're feeling is nerve regeneration. You know that. And "pins and needles" is a pretty good description of it.
Kevin: Yeah, except it felt more like buzz saws and pickaxes.
Lucy: I wonder why it happened so suddenly. I mean, maybe it was all those energy massages I gave you or the herbal tea I get. I made enough herbal tea to --
Ian: Or maybe it was rest and medication. Who knows, right?

Kevin: Or maybe it was a combination of everything along with the physical therapy. I mean, it's not that the massages weren't good -- they were -- but it'll be good to have a physical therapist put me through a rigorous workout every day.
Ian: Yeah. He's going to come see you twice a week.
Kevin: Great. Thank you, and especially thank you for everything you've been doing, Ian. I know what you have to deal with on a daily basis. Did I say something now?
Ian: What is it? What, what -- have to do with the situation every day, what?
Kevin: Well, it's just the three of us here. I didn't know that your situation was a forbidden subject. I mean, it's a fact.
Lucy: I think it was Christina. The reason you could move your arm like that is because you didn't want her to hurt herself, and so I think it was Christina that helped you.
Kevin: Yeah, and I'd be lying if I said I wasn't going to miss her, but I think it's time I get on with doing things on my own. Besides, you have enough to deal with between the girls and Ian.
Ian: And his situation, right?
Kevin: Ok, if you're trying to pick a fight with me, I'm at a bit of a disadvantage here.
Lucy: I don't think now is the time to do any of this, ok?
Ian: I'm just going to get some fresh air, ok?
Lucy: Excuse me.
Lucy: What -- what are you doing?
Ian: He's playing you. "Oh, poor Lucy has to live with a vampire."
Lucy: Hmm. So, what do you want to do? Want to go beat him up?
Ian: Come on. Beating him -- that's not what I'm worried about. It's -- I'm just going to cool off a little bit, ok? Please?
Lucy: Ok. But, please, for the record, I will never, ever let him come between us, no matter where he's living. Ok?
Ian: Ok.
Lucy: Ok.
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Shower runs]
Imani: La, la, la, la
Jamal: So what is your granddaughter hiding, Madea? Hmm? How am I supposed to protect her if I don't know what's really going on? Answer me that.
[Imani sings]
Jamal: I'm not sure what I was expecting to find, Imani, but this sure isn't it. What kind of trouble are you into?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lucy: Ian is right about you, you know.
Kevin: About what?

Lucy: About what you're trying to do -- pushing all his buttons, reminding of, what, his -- his situation. You know, you had a situation for at least a year. Do you need me to hold a mirror in front of your face so you can be reminded of everything you did -- no, wait a minute. I don't have to do that because I lived through personally every single horrible thing you did, so I don't need any reminding and you don't, either, and you know it.

Kevin: Well, that's fair. I behaved terribly. And I have no idea what turned things around, but whatever my behavior, it was treatable. Tell me, Lucy -- how do you treat Ian? How do you fix a vampire?
Ian's voice: You're in control of this. Don't let him get to you. You're in control. You're in control.
Lucy: I fix Ian by loving him with everything I have and by understanding what torments him.
Kevin: Fine, I get that. And I'm not saying this is his fault, but it is a fact of life, Lucy. And because you and I share a child together, you need to hear my side of it.
Lucy: Oh! I know your side of it.

Kevin: No, not all of it. Look, I don't like the man -- that's a given -- but I do admire his struggle. He helped save my life and I'm grateful for that. But he's a vampire, Lucy. He needs human blood to survive an eternal life. And now he's in this house, playing daddy to my daughter, and I'm stuck in this thing and barely able to move. So, yes, I'm concerned. I'm more than concerned.

Lucy: What? What are you so concerned about? You really believe that Ian's going to bite all of us, somehow turn us all into a family of vampires? He is in control, and Ian would sooner die than do any of that.
Kevin: And therein lies the problem because he can't die. He can only be destroyed by people like you.
Lucy: You do not understand what you're saying.
Kevin: I know exactly what I'm saying. So I have to -- I have to count on you to keep Christina safe from that monster that you've let into her life.
Lucy: Oh.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Caleb: It's good like this when there's nothing dividing us, right, Olivia? Right?
Livvie: Sometimes I do things. We all do things that may seem a little bit selfish on the surface, but really, Caleb, I do what's best for us.
Caleb: Such as?
Livvie: I don't know. Stretch the truth a little, maybe.
Caleb: A little deception, maybe?
Livvie: No, no. No, not really.
Caleb: Sweetheart, is there something you want to tell me?
[Knock on door]
Caleb: Whoever it is, they'll go away.
Livvie: What if they don't?
Caleb: Oh, I don't care. Do you?
Livvie: What if it's an emergency?
Alison: Caleb! Caleb, please, I need your help! Can you open up?
